text: English grammar lesson 9 in lesson 8 we
began to talk about the changes we make
when we report another person's words we
talked about changing reference words
words like pronouns and possessive
adjectives in this lesson lesson 9 will
continue to talk about the changes we
make in reported speech we're going to
talk about how we change verbs the focus
of this lesson will be on these two
questions how do we change verbs in
reported speech when do we need to
change the verb tense in reported
statements the first thing we'll talk
about is subject verb agreement in
reported speech we need to make changes
so that the statement is logical
remember that the subject must always
agree with the verb let me give you an
example quoted speech I love birthday
cakes with flowers said the girl
reported speech the girl said she loves
birthday cakes with flowers we had to
change the subject from I to she and the
verb must now agree with she so we add
the ending S loves now let's talk about
verb tense in reported speech verb
tenses often change that also means that
verb tenses sometimes stay the same how
do we know when it's necessary to change
the verb tense let me give you some
guidelines
what's your name my name is Claudia
where are you from I'm from Brazil and
Claudia do Brazilians celebrate
birthdays we celebrate birthdays just
like here we have birthday cake balloons
and presents okay alright did you hear
what she said she told us her name is
Claudia and she said she's from Brazil
Claudia said the Brazilians celebrate
birthdays just like here in the US she
said they have birthday cakes and
balloons and presents did you see that I
didn't change her verbs she said her
name is Claudia she is from Brazil and
Brazilians celebrate birthdays they have
cake balloons and presents
I kept the verb tenses because these are
facts and these are general truths so if
the speaker states a fact that is still
true at the time of reporting then we
can keep the present tense changing the
verb tense as possible but it isn't
necessary here's one more example
birthday cakes are common in many
cultures said the Baker here's the
reported statement the Baker said that
birthday cakes are common in many
cultures the present tense verb AR can
stay the same we don't have to change it
because this is a fact a general truth
also if the speaker tells about a future
event that has yet to happen at the time
of reporting then we can keep the future
tense changing the verb tense is
possible but it isn't necessary here's
an example next year I'll be 16 and I'll
have a big party said Ron here's the
reported statement Ron said that next
year he'll be 16 and he'll have a big
party if I'm reporting Ron's words in
the same year the future events heavy
to happen so I can keep the future tense
Claudia do you speak English at home I
speak English at home with my husband
okay
did you hear what she said Claudia said
that she speaks English at home now I'm
reporting her words and they were said
just seconds ago so because I'm doing
immediate reporting I don't need to make
changes to her verb tenses Claudia said
that she speaks English at home if words
are reported soon after they are spoken
verb tenses are not usually changed
example I love birthday cakes with
flowers said the girl listener 1 what
did she just say listener 2
she said she loves birthday cakes with
flowers Claudia do you have any children
I have one son and how old is he
he's four and a half okay did you hear
that Claudia says she has one son and
she says that he's four and a half now
there are a few reasons why I don't need
to change her verb tenses first of all
she just told me this it's immediate
reporting second of all these are facts
she has a son he's four and a half also
if you listen to my reporting verb I use
the present tense says she says she has
one son so if my reporting verb is in
the present tense I don't really need to
change the verbs that she said if the
reporting verb is in the simple present
present perfect or future tense verb
tenses are not changed let me give you
some examples
quoted speech I don't want you to buy me
anything for my birthday reported speech
Jonah's always says he doesn't want us
to buy him anything for his birthday
don't ask Jonah's what he wants for his
birthday he'll say he doesn't want you
to buy him anything
in our to reported statements we have
reporting verbs in the simple present
and in the future tense
so we can keep the reported words in the
present tense the only change we had to
make was for subject verb agreement the
last guideline I'll provide is about a
common practice in informal English in
informal English especially a
conversation verb tenses often stay the
same in reported speech here's a model
conversation between Kerry and Josh
Kerry Ron said he's throwing a big party
you think you'll go Josh yeah it'll be
fun
he said his parents are going to get a
DJ since it's his 16th birthday and all
because this is an informal conversation
we can keep Ron's original verb tenses
the present and the future are you ready
for an exercise
this is Costilla listen and report his
words example let's ask Costa where he's
from listen and report Kostas answer I
am from Russia did you hear what he said
Costa said he is from Russia we can
leave the present tense is because this
is a fact and he just told us number one
Costa is from Russia if we ask him what
language he speaks what do you think
he'll say answer he'll say he speaks
Russian
well Russian is logical of course speaks
is our only choice because our reporting
verb is in the future tense now listen
to Costas answer my native language is
Russian but I also speak English and
some French what did he say he said that
his native language is Russian and he
also speaks English and some French
because these are facts we don't have to
change verb tenses
let's ask ghost yet if he already
celebrated his birthday this year listen
and report his answer right now it's
June so I won't celebrate my birthday
for several more months What did he say
let's assume that it is still the month
of June he said that right now it is
June so he won't celebrate his birthday
for several more months
number three listen to what Costas says
about his birthday report his words
Americans think it's interesting that I
was born on December 25th that's when
they celebrate Christmas what did he say
he said that Americans think it's
interesting that he was born on December
25th that's when they celebrate
Christmas we can keep the verb tenses as
they are because first of all this is
immediate reporting and the second
sentence is a fact there's still more to
come in future lessons we'll talk about
changing the verb tense and reporting
with modal verbs reporting questions
reporting commands and using other
reporting verbs additional practice is
available at English cafe calm my
username is Jennifer ESL the follow-up
exercise to this lesson is now available
well that's all for now thanks for
watching and happy studies
